page.title: 12EDUCATION IN CRUWYS MORCHARD
page.content: With the old school closed children are bussed to either Tiverton area or Chulmleigh. Most aged 5 to 9 go to Bickleigh First School. They learn reading, writing, maths and follow a project approach to other subjects. When 9 years old children go to William Shapland Middle School in Tiverton. Here they gradually move from project work to learning in a subject based curriculum. At 13 they join all Tiverton area children at the Tiverton Comprehensive School. Here most take O-level or CSE exams at 16, the legal school-leaving age.Some go straight out to work, others sit further exams at the school or the College of Further Education for academic or craft qualifications. For tertiary education in colleges or universities young people have to go away from the area.
